verses.roman:
tān ahaṁ te 'bhidhāsyāmi
deva-vrata-makhāc chrutān
jñāna-vairāgya-vijñāna-
śraddhā-bhakty-upabṛṁhitān

synonyms: tān—those; aham—I; te—unto you; abhidhāsyāmi—will describe; deva-vrata—of Bhīṣmadeva; mukhāt—from the mouth; śrutān—heard; jñāna—Vedic knowledge; vairāgya—detachment; vijñāna—self-realization; śraddhā—faith; bhakti—and devotional service; upa-bṛṁhitān—consisting of.
translation: I will now speak unto you those religious principles of Vedic knowledge, detachment, self-realization, faith and devotional service that were heard directly from the mouth of Bhīṣmadeva.
